intro: Gilibertia grandis, commonly known as the giant gilbertia, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed or open habitats. It is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. The plant's distinctive appearance and ecological adaptability make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
